title: Eagle Eye directors spy tidy profit
text:

Tue, Sep 22, 2015, 17:50 BST - UK Markets closed Eagle Eye directors spy tidy profit By Edward Swift | Sharecast – 4 minutes 34 seconds ago 240.00 -1.7500 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Two Eagle Eye Solutions Group executives took home a tidy profit after cashing up a portion of their holdings on Tuesday. Chief technology officer and founder Stephen Rothwell sold 100,000 shares for £235,000, while chief executive Phill Blundell sold 50,000 for £117,500. 
The pair has been with the company since before it listed on the AIM markets, and haven't sold or bought any shares in the company until now. 
When it listed in April 2014 shares were initially traded for 180p, but the directors' shares were sold for 235p each. 
They still hold 1,611,672 and 260,976 shares respectively. 
On Wednesday, the software as a service (SaaS) technology company released its annual results, highlighting a 165% increase in revenue to £4.9m. 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) also generated gross profits of £3.5m - up 150% from last year.
